practice.question: Laravel install karne ka sabse easy tarika kya hai?
practice.answer: Laravel Installer use karna easiest hai: 'composer global require laravel/installer' aur phir 'laravel new project-name'

practice.question: .env file kya hai aur kyun important hai?
practice.answer: .env file environment variables store karti hai (database credentials, API keys). Security ke liye important hai aur different environments (local, production) ke liye alag values.

practice.question: Artisan kya hai?
practice.answer: Artisan Laravel ka command-line interface hai. Ye commands provide karta hai project management, code generation, database operations ke liye.

practice.question: Laravel Sail kya hai?
practice.answer: Laravel Sail Docker-based development environment hai jo pre-configured Docker setup provide karta hai local development ke liye.

practice.question: Web routes aur API routes mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: Web routes web.php file mein hote hain aur web middleware use karte hain. API routes api.php file mein hote hain aur api middleware use karte hain (stateless, throttle).

practice.question: Route parameters kaise define karte hain?
practice.answer: Curly braces mein: Route::get('/users/{id}', ...). Optional parameters ke liye question mark: {id?}. Constraints add kar sakte hain: where('id', '[0-9]+')

practice.question: Resource controller kya hai?
practice.answer: Resource controller CRUD operations ke liye predefined methods provide karta hai: index, create, store, show, edit, update, destroy.

practice.question: Route naming kyun important hai?
practice.answer: Route naming URL generation ko easy banata hai. route() helper se named routes ke liye URLs generate kar sakte hain. Route changes se bachata hai.

detailed_explanation.example_code:
<?php
// routes/web.php

// Basic routes
Route::get('/', function () {
    return view('welcome');
});

Route::get('/about', function () {
    return 'About Page';
});

// Route with parameters
Route::get('/users/{id}', function ($id) {
    return 'User ID: ' . $id;
});

// Route with optional parameter
Route::get('/users/{id?}', function ($id = null) {
    return $id ? 'User ID: ' . $id : 'All Users';
});

// Route with constraint
Route::get('/users/{id}', function ($id) {
    // Only numeric IDs allowed
})->where('id', '[0-9]+');

// Named routes
Route::get('/profile', function () {
    // Profile page
})->name('profile');

// Using in views: {{ route('profile') }}

// Controller routes
Route::get('/users', [UserController::class, 'index']);

// Resource controller (creates all CRUD routes)
Route::resource('users', UserController::class);
// Equivalent to:
// GET /users → index
// GET /users/create → create
// POST /users → store
// GET /users/{user} → show
// GET /users/{user}/edit → edit
// PUT/PATCH /users/{user} → update
// DELETE /users/{user} → destroy

// Route groups
Route::prefix('admin')->middleware('auth')->group(function () {
    Route::get('/dashboard', function () {
        // Admin dashboard
    });
    
    Route::resource('users', AdminUserController::class);
});

// Controller example
// app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php
namespace App\Http\Controllers;

use App\Models\User;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;

class UserController extends Controller
{
    public function index()
    {
        $users = User::all();
        return view('users.index', compact('users'));
    }
    
    public function show(User $user) // Route Model Binding
    {
        return view('users.show', compact('user'));
    }
    
    public function store(Request $request)
    {
        $validated = $request->validate([
            'name' => 'required|string|max:255',
            'email' => 'required|email|unique:users'
        ]);
        
        User::create($validated);
        
        return redirect()->route('users.index')
                         ->with('success', 'User created successfully.');
    }
}
?>

practice.question: @extends aur @include mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: @extends template inheritance ke liye hai (parent-child relationship). @include partial views include karne ke liye hai (reusable components).

practice.question: Blade ke safe operators kaise use karte hain?
practice.answer: {!! $html !!} raw HTML display karta hai (dangerous agar user input hai). {{ $variable }} automatically escape karta hai. {{ $variable ?? 'default' }} null coalescing.

practice.question: Blade components kya hain?
practice.answer: Blade components reusable UI pieces hain jo class-based ya anonymous ho sakte hain. Props accept karte hain, slots support karte hain, aur methods define kar sakte hain.

practice.question: @foreach aur @forelse mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: @foreach sirf loop ke liye hai. @forelse loop ke saath empty case bhi handle karta hai: @forelse($items as $item) ... @empty No items found @endforelse

topics.english: Working with databases using Laravel's Eloquent ORM and query builder

examples: Using query builder for complex queries
Working with model factories for testing

practice.question: Eloquent model aur migration mein kya relationship hai?
practice.answer: Migration database table structure define karti hai. Eloquent model table se data fetch/store karta hai. Model migration ke baad create karte hain.

practice.question: hasMany aur belongsTo mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: hasMany: one-to-many relationship (User hasMany Posts). belongsTo: inverse relationship (Post belongsTo User). belongsTo foreign key rakhta hai.

practice.question: Eager loading kya hai aur kyun important hai?
practice.answer: Eager loading related models ek saath load karta hai N+1 query problem solve karne ke liye. with() method se use karte hain.

practice.question: Query builder aur Eloquent mein kya choose karein?
practice.answer: Eloquent object-oriented, relationships ke liye better. Query builder complex queries, raw expressions ke liye better. Performance ke liye query builder better hai.

detailed_explanation.example_code:
<?php
// app/Models/User.php
namespace App\Models;

use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Model;
use Illuminate\Database\Eloquent\Factories\HasFactory;
use Illuminate\Notifications\Notifiable;
use Illuminate\Foundation\Auth\User as Authenticatable;

class User extends Authenticatable
{
    use HasFactory, Notifiable;
    
    protected $fillable = [
        'name', 'email', 'password'
    ];
    
    protected $hidden = [
        'password', 'remember_token'
    ];
    
    protected $casts = [
        'email_verified_at' => 'datetime',
        'is_admin' => 'boolean'
    ];
    
    // Relationships
    public function posts()
    {
        return $this->hasMany(Post::class);
    }
    
    public function profile()
    {
        return $this->hasOne(Profile::class);
    }
    
    public function roles()
    {
        return $this->belongsToMany(Role::class);
    }
}

// app/Models/Post.php
class Post extends Model
{
    use HasFactory;
    
    protected $fillable = ['title', 'content', 'user_id'];
    
    public function user()
    {
        return $this->belongsTo(User::class);
    }
    
    public function tags()
    {
        return $this->belongsToMany(Tag::class);
    }
    
    public function scopePublished($query)
    {
        return $query->where('published', true);
    }
    
    public function scopeLatest($query)
    {
        return $query->orderBy('created_at', 'desc');
    }
}

// Database operations
// Creating records
$user = User::create([
    'name' => 'John Doe',
    'email' => 'john@example.com',
    'password' => bcrypt('password123')
]);

// Or
$user = new User();
$user->name = 'Jane Doe';
$user->email = 'jane@example.com';
$user->save();

// Reading records
$users = User::all(); // Get all users
$user = User::find(1); // Find by primary key
$user = User::where('email', 'john@example.com')->first();
$admins = User::where('is_admin', true)->get();

// Eager loading
$posts = Post::with('user', 'tags')->get();

// Updating records
$user = User::find(1);
$user->name = 'John Updated';
$user->save();

// Or
User::where('id', 1)->update(['name' => 'John Updated']);

// Deleting records
$user->delete();
User::destroy(1);
User::where('is_admin', false)->delete();

// Query Builder examples
$users = DB::table('users')
            ->select('name', 'email')
            ->where('status', 'active')
            ->orderBy('name')
            ->limit(10)
            ->get();

// Complex query
$popularPosts = DB::table('posts')
    ->join('users', 'posts.user_id', '=', 'users.id')
    ->select('posts.*', 'users.name as author_name')
    ->where('posts.published', true)
    ->whereBetween('posts.created_at', [now()->subMonth(), now()])
    ->orderBy('posts.view_count', 'desc')
    ->paginate(15);

// Raw expressions
$users = DB::table('users')
    ->select(DB::raw('count(*) as user_count, status'))
    ->where('status', '<>', 1)
    ->groupBy('status')
    ->get();

// Migration example
// database/migrations/2024_01_01_000000_create_users_table.php
use Illuminate\Database\Migrations\Migration;
use Illuminate\Database\Schema\Blueprint;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Schema;

class CreateUsersTable extends Migration
{
    public function up()
    {
        Schema::create('users', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->id();
            $table->string('name');
            $table->string('email')->unique();
            $table->timestamp('email_verified_at')->nullable();
            $table->string('password');
            $table->boolean('is_admin')->default(false);
            $table->rememberToken();
            $table->timestamps(); // created_at, updated_at
            $table->softDeletes(); // deleted_at
        });
    }
    
    public function down()
    {
        Schema::dropIfExists('users');
    }
}

// Seeder example
// database/seeders/DatabaseSeeder.php
class DatabaseSeeder extends Seeder
{
    public function run()
    {
        // Create 10 users
        User::factory(10)->create();
        
        // Create admin user
        User::factory()->create([
            'name' => 'Admin User',
            'email' => 'admin@example.com',
            'is_admin' => true
        ]);
        
        // Create posts for each user
        User::all()->each(function ($user) {
            Post::factory(5)->create(['user_id' => $user->id]);
        });
    }
}

// Factory example
// database/factories/UserFactory.php
class UserFactory extends Factory
{
    public function definition()
    {
        return [
            'name' => fake()->name(),
            'email' => fake()->unique()->safeEmail(),
            'email_verified_at' => now(),
            'password' => Hash::make('password'),
            'remember_token' => Str::random(10),
        ];
    }
    
    public function unverified()
    {
        return $this->state(fn (array $attributes) => [
            'email_verified_at' => null,
        ]);
    }
}
?>

practice.question: Laravel authentication kaise set up karte hain?
practice.answer: 'php artisan make:auth' (older) ya 'laravel/ui' package. Laravel 8+ mein 'php artisan ui bootstrap --auth' ya 'composer require laravel/breeze' ya 'composer require laravel/jetstream'

practice.question: Policies aur Gates mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: Policies model-specific authorization ke liye hain (PostPolicy). Gates general abilities ke liye hain (edit-settings, visit-admin).

practice.question: Social authentication kaise implement karte hain?
practice.answer: Socialite package use karte hain. Providers (Google, Facebook, GitHub) configure karte hain. Callback handle karte hain aur user create/find karte hain.

practice.question: Remember me functionality kaise implement karte hain?
practice.answer: Login form mein remember checkbox add karte hain. Auth::attempt() mein remember parameter true set karte hain. Laravel automatically remember token manage karta hai.

practice.question: Middleware kya hota hai?
practice.answer: Middleware HTTP request aur response ke beech filter ka kaam karta hai. Request process hone se pehle ya response bhejne se pehle execution hota hai.

practice.question: Form Request kya hai?
practice.answer: Form Request special class hai jo validation logic aur authorization contain karta hai. Controller se validation logic separate karta hai.

practice.question: Rate limiting kaise implement karte hain?
practice.answer: Throttle middleware use karte hain. Route ya global middleware ke through. API calls limit kar sakte hain user/IP basis par.

practice.question: Custom validation rule kaise banate hain?
practice.answer: 'php artisan make:rule RuleName' se rule class create karte hain. Passes() method mein validation logic define karte hain.

detailed_explanation.example_code:
<?php
// Creating middleware
// php artisan make:middleware CheckAge

namespace App\Http\Middleware;

use Closure;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;

class CheckAge
{
    public function handle(Request $request, Closure $next)
    {
        if ($request->age <= 18) {
            return redirect('home');
        }
        
        return $next($request);
    }
}

// Register middleware in kernel
// app/Http/Kernel.php
protected $routeMiddleware = [
    'age' => \App\Http\Middleware\CheckAge::class,
    // ...
];

// Using middleware
Route::get('/adults-only', function () {
    // Adults only content
})->middleware('age');

// Group middleware
Route::middleware(['auth', 'verified'])->group(function () {
    Route::get('/dashboard', [DashboardController::class, 'index']);
});

// Global middleware
// app/Http/Kernel.php
protected $middleware = [
    \App\Http\Middleware\TrustProxies::class,
    \App\Http\Middleware\CheckForMaintenanceMode::class,
    // ...
];

// Form Request
// php artisan make:request StorePostRequest

namespace App\Http\Requests;

use Illuminate\Foundation\Http\FormRequest;

class StorePostRequest extends FormRequest
{
    public function authorize()
    {
        return $this->user()->can('create', Post::class);
    }
    
    public function rules()
    {
        return [
            'title' => 'required|string|max:255',
            'content' => 'required|string|min:100',
            'category_id' => 'required|exists:categories,id',
            'tags' => 'array',
            'tags.*' => 'exists:tags,id',
            'published_at' => 'nullable|date',
            'image' => 'nullable|image|max:2048',
        ];
    }
    
    public function messages()
    {
        return [
            'title.required' => 'A title is required',
            'content.min' => 'Content must be at least 100 characters',
        ];
    }
    
    public function attributes()
    {
        return [
            'category_id' => 'category',
        ];
    }
}

// Using form request in controller
public function store(StorePostRequest $request)
{
    // Request is already validated and authorized
    $post = Post::create($request->validated());
    
    if ($request->hasFile('image')) {
        $path = $request->file('image')->store('posts', 'public');
        $post->update(['image_path' => $path]);
    }
    
    if ($request->has('tags')) {
        $post->tags()->attach($request->tags);
    }
    
    return redirect()->route('posts.show', $post);
}

practice.answer: API resource data transformation layer hai jo Eloquent models ko JSON mein convert karta hai. Format control, relationships include, aur meta data add kar sakte hain.

practice.question: Sanctum aur Passport mein kya choose karein?
practice.answer: Sanctum simple token-based authentication ke liye (SPA, mobile apps). Passport full OAuth2 server ke liye (third-party apps ko access dena).

practice.question: API versioning kaise implement karte hain?
practice.answer: URL versioning (/api/v1/users), header versioning, ya route prefixing. Laravel mein route groups aur middleware se implement karte hain.

practice.question: GraphQL ke advantages kya hain REST ke comparison mein?
practice.answer: Single endpoint, client specifies needed data (no over-fetching), strong typing, introspection. REST simpler hai, caching better hai, tooling mature hai.

<?php
// API routes
// routes/api.php

Route::middleware('auth:sanctum')->group(function () {

// API Controller
// php artisan make:controller Api/UserController --api

namespace App\Http\Controllers\Api;

use App\Http\Controllers\Controller;
use App\Http\Resources\UserResource;
use App\Models\User;
use Illuminate\Http\Request;

class UserController extends Controller
{
    public function index()
    {
        $users = User::with('posts')->paginate(20);
        return UserResource::collection($users);
    }
    
    public function show(User $user)
    {
        return new UserResource($user->load('posts'));
    }
    
    public function store(Request $request)
    {
        $validated = $request->validate([
            'name' => 'required|string|max:255',
            'email' => 'required|email|unique:users',
            'password' => 'required|min:8',
        ]);
        
        $user = User::create($validated);
        
        return new UserResource($user);
    }
    
    public function update(Request $request, User $user)
    {
        $validated = $request->validate([
            'name' => 'sometimes|string|max:255',
            'email' => 'sometimes|email|unique:users,email,' . $user->id,
        ]);
        
        $user->update($validated);
        
        return new UserResource($user);
    }
    
    public function destroy(User $user)
    {
        $user->delete();
        
        return response()->json([
            'message' => 'User deleted successfully'
        ]);
    }
}

// API Resource
// php artisan make:resource UserResource

namespace App\Http\Resources;

use Illuminate\Http\Resources\Json\JsonResource;

class UserResource extends JsonResource
{
    public function toArray($request)
    {
        return [
            'id' => $this->id,
            'name' => $this->name,
            'email' => $this->email,
            'created_at' => $this->created_at->toISOString(),
            'updated_at' => $this->updated_at->toISOString(),
            'posts' => PostResource::collection($this->whenLoaded('posts')),
            'links' => [
                'self' => route('api.users.show', $this->id),
                'posts' => route('api.users.posts.index', $this->id),
            ],
        ];
    }
    
    public function with($request)
    {
        return [
            'meta' => [
                'version' => '1.0.0',
                'author' => 'Your Name',
            ],
        ];
    }
}

// Sanctum API Authentication
// Install: composer require laravel/sanctum
// php artisan vendor:publish --provider="Laravel\Sanctum\SanctumServiceProvider"
// php artisan migrate

// Create token
Route::post('/api/login', function (Request $request) {
    $request->validate([
        'email' => 'required|email',
        'password' => 'required',
        'device_name' => 'required',
    ]);
    
    $user = User::where('email', $request->email)->first();
    
    if (!$user || !Hash::check($request->password, $user->password)) {
        throw ValidationException::withMessages([
            'email' => ['The provided credentials are incorrect.'],
        ]);
    }
    
    $token = $user->createToken($request->device_name)->plainTextToken;
    
    return response()->json([
        'token' => $token,
        'user' => new UserResource($user),
    ]);
});

// Protected route
Route::middleware('auth:sanctum')->get('/api/user', function (Request $request) {
    return $request->user();
});

// Revoke token
Route::post('/api/logout', function (Request $request) {
    $request->user()->currentAccessToken()->delete();
    
    return response()->json(['message' => 'Logged out']);
});

    // V1 routes

// API caching

{

// API rate limiting

// Custom API responses
public function respond($data, $status = 200, $message = null)
{
    return response()->json([
        'success' => $status >= 200 && $status < 300,
        'message' => $message,
        'data' => $data,
    ], $status);
}

public function respondError($message, $status = 400)
{

}

practice.question: Queue kya hoti hai aur kyun use karte hain?
practice.answer: Queue background mein tasks process karti hai. Time-consuming tasks (emails, image processing) ke liye use karte hain taki user response fast mile.

practice.question: Different queue drivers ke options kya hain?
practice.answer: Sync (for testing), Database, Redis, Beanstalkd, Amazon SQS, RabbitMQ. Redis recommended hai performance ke liye.

practice.question: Job batching kya hoti hai?
practice.answer: Multiple jobs ko ek group mein run karna, progress track karna, aur batch complete hone par callback run karna.

practice.question: Failed jobs kaise handle karte hain?

detailed_explanation.example_code:
<?php
// Creating a job
// php artisan make:job ProcessPodcast

namespace App\Jobs;

use Illuminate\Bus\Queueable;
use Illuminate\Contracts\Queue\ShouldQueue;
use Illuminate\Foundation\Bus\Dispatchable;
use Illuminate\Queue\InteractsWithQueue;
use Illuminate\Queue\SerializesModels;
use App\Models\Podcast;

class ProcessPodcast implements ShouldQueue
{
    use Dispatchable, InteractsWithQueue, Queueable, SerializesModels;
    
    public $tries = 3; // Number of retry attempts
    public $maxExceptions = 3; // Max exceptions before failing
    public $timeout = 120; // Job timeout in seconds
    public $backoff = [60, 120, 300]; // Retry delay in seconds
    
    protected $podcast;
    
    public function __construct(Podcast $podcast)
    {
        $this->podcast = $podcast;
    }
    
    public function handle()
    {
        // Process the podcast...
        // This could be: converting audio, generating thumbnails, etc.
        
        // Update podcast status
        $this->podcast->update(['status' => 'processed']);
        
        // Send notification
        $this->podcast->user->notify(new PodcastProcessed($this->podcast));
    }
    
    public function failed(Throwable $exception)
    {
        // Handle job failure
        $this->podcast->update(['status' => 'failed']);
        
        // Notify admin about failure
        // Mail::to('admin@example.com')->send(new JobFailedMail($this->podcast, $exception));
    }
}

// Dispatching jobs
// From controller
public function store(Request $request)
{
    $podcast = Podcast::create($request->validated());
    
    // Dispatch immediately
    ProcessPodcast::dispatch($podcast);
    
    // Or with delay
    ProcessPodcast::dispatch($podcast)
        ->delay(now()->addMinutes(10));
    
    // Dispatch on specific queue
    ProcessPodcast::dispatch($podcast)
        ->onQueue('audio');
    
    return response()->json(['message' => 'Podcast processing started']);
}

// Queue configuration
// config/queue.php
'default' => env('QUEUE_CONNECTION', 'sync'),

'connections' => [
    'sync' => [
        'driver' => 'sync',
    ],
    
    'database' => [
        'driver' => 'database',
        'table' => 'jobs',
        'queue' => 'default',
        'retry_after' => 90,
    ],
    
    'redis' => [
        'driver' => 'redis',
        'connection' => 'default',
        'queue' => env('REDIS_QUEUE', 'default'),
        'retry_after' => 90,
        'block_for' => null,
    ],
],

// Running queue workers
// Start worker
php artisan queue:work

// With specific connection
php artisan queue:work redis

// Process specific queue
php artisan queue:work --queue=high,default

// Job batching
$batch = Bus::batch([
    new ProcessPodcast($podcast1),
    new ProcessPodcast($podcast2),
    new ProcessPodcast($podcast3),
])->then(function (Batch $batch) {
    // All jobs completed successfully
})->catch(function (Batch $batch, Throwable $e) {
    // First batch job failure detected
})->finally(function (Batch $batch) {
    // The batch has finished executing
})->dispatch();

// Job chaining
ProcessPodcast::withChain([
    new OptimizePodcast($podcast),
    new ReleasePodcast($podcast),
])->dispatch($podcast);

// Event broadcasting (real-time)
// php artisan make:event PodcastProcessed

namespace App\Events;

use Illuminate\Broadcasting\Channel;
use Illuminate\Broadcasting\InteractsWithSockets;
use Illuminate\Broadcasting\PresenceChannel;
use Illuminate\Broadcasting\PrivateChannel;
use Illuminate\Contracts\Broadcasting\ShouldBroadcast;
use Illuminate\Foundation\Events\Dispatchable;
use Illuminate\Queue\SerializesModels;

class PodcastProcessed implements ShouldBroadcast
{
    use Dispatchable, InteractsWithSockets, SerializesModels;
    
    public $podcast;
    
    public function __construct(Podcast $podcast)
    {
        $this->podcast = $podcast;
    }
    
    public function broadcastOn()
    {
        return new Channel('podcasts');
        // Or private channel
        // return new PrivateChannel('podcasts.' . $this->podcast->id);
    }
    
    public function broadcastWith()
    {
        return [
            'id' => $this->podcast->id,
            'title' => $this->podcast->title,
            'status' => 'processed',
        ];
    }
}

// Broadcasting from job
public function handle()
{
    // Process podcast
    broadcast(new PodcastProcessed($this->podcast));
}

// Setting up broadcasting (Pusher/Redis)
// Install: composer require pusher/pusher-php-server
// Or for Redis: composer require predis/predis

// config/broadcasting.php
'connections' => [
    'pusher' => [
        'driver' => 'pusher',
        'key' => env('PUSHER_APP_KEY'),
        'secret' => env('PUSHER_APP_SECRET'),
        'app_id' => env('PUSHER_APP_ID'),
        'options' => [
            'cluster' => env('PUSHER_APP_CLUSTER'),
            'useTLS' => true,
        ],
    ],
    
    'redis' => [
        'driver' => 'redis',
        'connection' => 'default',
    ],
],

// Frontend setup (Laravel Echo)
// npm install --save laravel-echo pusher-js

// resources/js/bootstrap.js
import Echo from 'laravel-echo';
import Pusher from 'pusher-js';

window.Pusher = Pusher;

window.Echo = new Echo({
    broadcaster: 'pusher',
    key: process.env.MIX_PUSHER_APP_KEY,
    cluster: process.env.MIX_PUSHER_APP_CLUSTER,
    forceTLS: true
});

// Listening to events
window.Echo.channel('podcasts')
    .listen('PodcastProcessed', (e) => {
        console.log('Podcast processed:', e.podcast.title);
    });

// Schedule jobs (Task Scheduling)
// app/Console/Kernel.php
protected function schedule(Schedule $schedule)
{
    // Run command daily
    $schedule->command('inspire')->daily();
    
    // Run queue worker every minute
    $schedule->command('queue:work --stop-when-empty')
             ->everyMinute()
             ->withoutOverlapping();
    
    // Run job daily at specific time
    $schedule->job(new SendDailyReport)->dailyAt('23:55');
    
    // Run callback
    $schedule->call(function () {
        DB::table('recent_users')->delete();
    })->weekly();
}

// On server: set up cron
// * * * * * cd /path-to-your-project && php artisan schedule:run >> /dev/null 2>&1
?>

practice.question: Unit test aur feature test mein kya difference hai?
practice.answer: Unit test small units (methods, classes) ko isolate test karta hai. Feature test complete features ko user perspective se test karta hai (multiple components).

practice.question: Database testing ke liye best practices kya hain?
practice.answer: RefreshDatabase trait use karo, factories se test data create karo, database assertions use karo (assertDatabaseHas), aur test database separate rakhho.

practice.question: Laravel Telescope kya hai?
practice.answer: Telescope debugging aur monitoring tool hai jo requests, exceptions, database queries, jobs, etc. debug karne mein help karta hai.

practice.question: Mocking kya hai aur kahan use karna chahiye?
practice.answer: Mocking fake objects create karta hai external dependencies simulate karne ke liye. APIs, services, aur complex dependencies ke liye use karna chahiye.

// Performance testing
public function test_homepage_loads_quickly()
{
    $start = microtime(true);
    
    $response = $this->get('/');
    
    $end = microtime(true);
    $loadTime = ($end - $start) * 1000; // Convert to milliseconds
    
    $response->assertStatus(200);
    
    // Assert page loads in less than 500ms
    $this->assertLessThan(500, $loadTime);
}

// Debugging with dd() and dump()
public function debug_method()
{
    $users = User::with('posts')->get();
    
    // Dump and die
    dd($users);
    
    // Dump and continue
    dump($users);
    
    // Logging
    \Log::info('Users fetched', ['count' => $users->count()]);
    \Log::error('Something went wrong!');
    
    // Throw exception for debugging
    throw new \Exception('Debugging exception');
}

practice.question: Production deployment se pehle kya-kya steps follow karna chahiye?
practice.answer: Environment check, composer install --no-dev, npm run production, storage link, cache clear, config cache, route cache, view cache, migration run.

practice.question: .env file production mein kaise manage karte hain?
practice.answer: .env file manually create karte hain production server par. Ya environment variables server level par set karte hain. Never commit .env to version control.

practice.question: Laravel Forge kya hai?
practice.answer: Laravel Forge server provisioning aur deployment automation tool hai. DigitalOcean, AWS, etc. par servers provision aur deploy karne mein help karta hai.

practice.question: Docker ke saath Laravel kaise deploy karte hain?
practice.answer: Dockerfile create karte hain, docker-compose.yml define karte hain, images build karte hain, aur containers run karte hain. Laravel Sail pre-configured Docker environment provide karta hai.

detailed_explanation.example_code:
<?php
// Deployment checklist

// 1. Environment preparation
// Update .env file with production values
APP_ENV=production
APP_DEBUG=false
APP_URL=https://yourdomain.com

// Database configuration
DB_CONNECTION=mysql
DB_HOST=127.0.0.1
DB_PORT=3306
DB_DATABASE=production_db
DB_USERNAME=production_user
DB_PASSWORD=secure_password

// Cache/Session driver (Redis recommended)
CACHE_DRIVER=redis
SESSION_DRIVER=redis
QUEUE_CONNECTION=redis

// 2. Deployment commands
// Pull latest code
git pull origin main

// Install dependencies
composer install --optimize-autoloader --no-dev

// NPM build
npm ci --only=production
npm run production

// Environment
cp .env.example .env  # Or create manually
php artisan key:generate

// Database migrations
php artisan migrate --force

// Link storage
php artisan storage:link

// Cache optimization
php artisan config:cache
php artisan route:cache
php artisan view:cache
php artisan event:cache

// Queue workers (supervisor setup)
// See supervisor configuration below

// 3. Nginx configuration
// /etc/nginx/sites-available/yourdomain.com
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name yourdomain.com www.yourdomain.com;
    root /var/www/yourproject/public;

    add_header X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN";
    add_header X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff";

    index index.php;

    charset utf-8;

    location / {
        try_files $uri $uri/ /index.php?$query_string;
    }

    location = /favicon.ico { access_log off; log_not_found off; }
    location = /robots.txt  { access_log off; log_not_found off; }

    error_page 404 /index.php;

    location ~ \.php$ {
        fastcgi_pass unix:/var/run/php/php8.3-fpm.sock;
        fastcgi_param SCRIPT_FILENAME $realpath_root$fastcgi_script_name;
        include fastcgi_params;
    }

    location ~ /\.(?!well-known).* {
        deny all;
    }
}

// 4. Supervisor configuration for queue workers
// /etc/supervisor/conf.d/laravel-worker.conf
[program:laravel-worker]
process_name=%(program_name)s_%(process_num)02d
command=php /var/www/yourproject/artisan queue:work redis --sleep=3 --tries=3 --max-time=3600
autostart=true
autorestart=true
stopasgroup=true
killasgroup=true
user=www-data
numprocs=8
redirect_stderr=true
stdout_logfile=/var/www/yourproject/storage/logs/worker.log
stopwaitsecs=3600

// Start supervisor
sudo supervisorctl reread
sudo supervisorctl update
sudo supervisorctl start laravel-worker:*

// 5. Laravel Forge setup
// Connect Forge to your server provider (DigitalOcean, AWS, etc.)
// Forge automates:
// - Server provisioning
// - Nginx configuration
// - SSL certificates (Let's Encrypt)
// - Deployment scripts
// - Queue management
// - Database management

// 6. Docker deployment
// Dockerfile
FROM php:8.3-fpm

# Install dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    git \
    curl \
    libpng-dev \
    libonig-dev \
    libxml2-dev \
    zip \
    unzip \
    libpq-dev

# Clear cache
RUN apt-get clean && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install PHP extensions
RUN docker-php-ext-install pdo_mysql mbstring exif pcntl bcmath gd

# Get latest Composer
COPY --from=composer:latest /usr/bin/composer /usr/bin/composer

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /var/www

# Copy existing application directory
COPY . /var/www

# Install dependencies
RUN composer install --optimize-autoloader --no-dev

# Copy .env
COPY .env.production .env

# Generate key
RUN php artisan key:generate

# Set permissions
RUN chown -R www-data:www-data /var/www/storage
RUN chmod -R 775 /var/www/storage

EXPOSE 9000
CMD ["php-fpm"]

// docker-compose.yml
version: '3.8'

services:
  app:
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: laravel_app
    restart: unless-stopped
    working_dir: /var/www
    volumes:
      - ./:/var/www
      - ./docker/php/php.ini:/usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/php.ini
    networks:
      - laravel

  nginx:
    image: nginx:alpine
    container_name: laravel_nginx
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "80:80"
      - "443:443"
    volumes:
      - ./:/var/www
      - ./docker/nginx/conf.d/:/etc/nginx/conf.d/
    networks:
      - laravel

  mysql:
    image: mysql:8.0
    container_name: laravel_mysql
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      MYSQL_DATABASE: ${DB_DATABASE}
      MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD}
      MYSQL_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD}
      MYSQL_USER: ${DB_USERNAME}
    volumes:
      - dbdata:/var/lib/mysql
    networks:
      - laravel

  redis:
    image: redis:alpine
    container_name: laravel_redis
    restart: unless-stopped
    networks:
      - laravel

volumes:
  dbdata:

networks:
  laravel:
    driver: bridge

// 7. CI/CD with GitHub Actions
// .github/workflows/deploy.yml
name: Deploy Laravel

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v2
      
    - name: Setup PHP
      uses: shivammathur/setup-php@v2
      with:
        php-version: '8.3'
    
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: composer install --no-dev --optimize-autoloader
    
    - name: Run tests
      run: vendor/bin/phpunit
      
    - name: Deploy to production
      uses: appleboy/ssh-action@master
      with:
        host: ${{ secrets.HOST }}
        username: ${{ secrets.USERNAME }}
        key: ${{ secrets.SSH_KEY }}
        script: |
          cd /var/www/yourproject
          git pull origin main
          composer install --no-dev --optimize-autoloader
          php artisan migrate --force
          php artisan config:cache
          php artisan route:cache
          php artisan view:cache
          sudo supervisorctl restart laravel-worker:*

// 8. Performance optimization

// Database optimization
// Use indexes
// Optimize queries (avoid N+1)
// Use caching

// Cache configuration
// config/cache.php
'default' => env('CACHE_DRIVER', 'file'),

'stores' => [
    'file' => [
        'driver' => 'file',
        'path' => storage_path('framework/cache/data'),
    ],
    
    'redis' => [

],

// Caching in code
// Cache for 1 hour
$users = Cache::remember('users', 3600, function () {
    return User::with('posts')->get();
});

// Cache tags (Redis only)
Cache::tags(['users', 'posts'])->put('key', $value, 3600);

// Clear cache
expiration artisan cache:clear
php artisan config:clear
php artisan route:clear
php artisan view:clear

// 9. Monitoring and logging

// Logging configuration
// config/logging.php
'channels' => [
    'stack' => [
        'driver' => 'stack',
        'channels' => ['single', 'slack'],
        'ignore_exceptions' => false,
    ],
    
    'single' => [
        'driver' => 'single',
        'path' => storage_path('logs/laravel.log'),
        'level' => 'debug',
    ],
    
    'slack' => [
        'driver' => 'slack',
        'url' => env('LOG_SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL'),
        'username' => 'Laravel Log',
        'emoji' => ':boom:',
        'level' => 'critical',
    ],
],

// Error tracking with Sentry/Bugsnag
// Install: composer require sentry/sentry-laravel

// AppServiceProvider.php
\Sentry\Laravel\Integration::handlesExceptions();

// 10. Security hardening

// CSRF protection (enabled by default)
// XSS protection
// SQL injection prevention (Eloquent/Query Builder)
// HTTPS enforcement
// Secure headers
// Rate limiting
// Input validation
// File upload validation
// Password hashing

// Force HTTPS in production
// AppServiceProvider.php
if (app()->environment('production')) {
    \URL::forceScheme('https');
}

// Or in .env
APP_URL=https://yourdomain.com
FORCE_HTTPS=true

// Secure headers middleware
// Create middleware: php artisan make:middleware SecureHeaders

public function handle($request, Closure $next)
{
    $response = $next($request);
    
    $response->headers->set('X-Frame-Options', 'DENY');
    $response->headers->set('X-Content-Type-Options', 'nosniff');
    $response->headers->set('X-XSS-Protection', '1; mode=block');
    $response->headers->set('Strict-Transport-Security', 'max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains');
    
    return $response;
}
